Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size-selection effect allows entry into mesoporous channels, coupled with specific affinity interaction by guanidyl groups for capture and enrichment.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Various samples including β-casein tryptic digest, α-casein tryptic digest, non-fat milk tryptic digest, rat liver lysate tryptic digest, and human saliva; enrichment process incubated at room temperature for 30 min.
Other Information.Additional Info: Considered 'small-sized' relative to proteins, successfully captured and identified, including 63 unique endogenous phosphopeptides from human saliva.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion, prevented from entering the mesoporous channels due to their larger size.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Mixed with β-casein tryptic digest (e.g., molar ratio of β-casein tryptic digest/IgG/BSA was 1:500:500); room temperature.
Other Information.Additional Info: β-casein (MW = 23,000), BSA (MW = 66,000). No peaks detected after enrichment, indicating effective exclusion.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Excluded by the specific affinity interactions of guanidyl groups, preventing non-specific binding.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Mixed with phosphopeptides (e.g., molar ratios of β-casein and BSA tryptic digests 1:100, 1:1000); non-fat milk tryptic digest; room temperature.
Other Information.Additional Info: High selectivity achieved by preventing the detection of non-phosphopeptide peaks in the spectrum.

Sieving Mechanism: Combined molecular sieving based on the regular mesoporous pore aperture and specific chemical affinity (guanidyl groups) for targeted size-selection and exclusion.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: High selectivity (β-casein/BSA = 1:1000), extremely high sensitivity (5 × 10−11 M), excellent size-exclusion effect (β-casein digests/β-casein/BSA = 1:500:500), good reusability (at least 5 cycles). Successfully enriched 63 unique endogenous phosphopeptides from 10 μL human saliva.

Other Information.Additional Info: Novel guanidyl-functionalized magnetic covalent organic framework (COF) nanosphere; synthesized via sequential post-synthetic modification; possessed superior superparamagnetic responsiveness (~42 emu/g saturation magnetization); primarily designed and used for highly selective capture and enrichment of endogenous phosphopeptides from complex biological samples.
